event.name: FRONTIER_DOGFIGHT
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find a Duskbringer transport sparring with an MV Rebel some distance away. If you wanted, you could try and take on one of the vessels yourself, though there's no telling what sort of response you'd receive from the other ship afterwards.
You draw the MV Rebel's attention and prepare to engage with it.
You open fire at the transport to draw its attention, which retaliates by boarding you with several Duskbringers!

choice.text: Stay uninvolved - this isn't your fight.

event.text: You don't fancy getting caught in the crossfire between two warring vessels both openly hostile to the Federation, so you steer far away from the conflict and find a nice quiet place to charge the FTL drive.

destroyed.text: The MV Rebel explodes into an assortment of scrap matter and other useful materials.

deadCrew.text: The MV Rebel's crew has been neutralized, leaving their ship a lifeless wreck. You collect all that you can find.

event.name: FRONTIER_DOGFIGHT_DUSK_CHECKIN
event.text: The Duskbringer transport hails you, their ship a little worse for wear but still in relatively good shape. "As much as I hate to admit it, your assistance was indeed timely. We were tasked with delivering military supplies to the Rebels, but I highly doubt we'd make it there alive given the poor reception. Here, have some supplies - we won't be needing them anymore."

choice.text: Accept their gift and wish them on their way.
(Duskbringer Crew) Ask to buy a weapon.

event.text: The captain mulls it over for a while before eventually agreeing to trade with you. "I suppose it's fine for you to buy a weapon, given that we're heading straight back to the Capitol after this."

destroyed.text: The Duskbringer transport explodes violently, whatever goods the ship contained having surely been destroyed in the process. However, you manage to salvage a good amount of scrap and functional ammunition from the wreckage.

choice.text: Check in with the MV Rebels.

deadCrew.text: The Duskbringer transport has been emptied of crew. Inside, you find some scrap and an Energy weapon, which you haul back to the ship in triumph.

event.text: The MV Rebel hails you. "I don't know why on earth you decided to help us back there, and I frankly don't care. That said, I suppose I can feed the fleet false information as payback - beats doing border patrol I guess." The MV Rebel jumps away.

The MV Rebel hails you, their captain's sunny disposition contrasting with the poor state of their ship's engines. "Thanks for the assist - those Duskbringers didn't know the meaning of 'import tax'. Now, I know we've got our differences and all, but I'm a businessman, and I firmly believe that any disagreement can be solved with scrap. Have some, on the house."

The MV Rebel makes no attempt to hail you, jumping away in a puff of smoke a short while later. You feel a sense of dread as you realize your location has likely been compromised, but at least you can salvage some debris left behind from the jump.

event.name: FRONTIER_ELITE_INSULT
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to see a particularly well-armed Elite Rebel jump in and attempt to hail you. Surprised, you accept and are met with a young Rebel clad in heavy-duty armor, who proceeds to keel over laughing at the sight of your ship. "So THIS is the Renegade command's been sending ships everywhere to find? HA! Given the size of the bounty on your head, I'd have thought you'd be piloting something big, not this tiny little thing!".

choice.text: How dare you! Man the guns.

event.text: The Rebel captain smirks at you, their weapons system coming to life with an audible hum. "Ah Renegades, foolhardy as always. Prepare to be crushed, squirt."

Without missing a beat, you fire a salvo directly into the Elite's shields, creating a massive explosion and sending their crew into chaos. The captain hastily apologizes and ejects a weapon out the airlock as surrender before running as far away from your ship as physically possible."

choice.text: (Damaging Pre-Emptive Weapon) Snipe them while they're exposed.

event.text: You fire your pre-emptive weapon directly into the Elite's weapons system, ripping a hole into it. The captain's haughty disposition quickly fades away as they realize your ship is no small threat. "Alright alright, you've made your point already! Would a weapon suffice to leave us alone?"

choice.text: Nah, we'll just murder you anyways.

event.text: The captain steels their resolve and prepares to face you in combat.

choice.text: (Damaging Pre-Emptive Weapon) Snipe them while they're exposed.

event.text: You fire your pre-emptive weapon directly into the Elite's weapons system, damaging it and lighting it ablaze. The captain's haughty disposition quickly fades away as they realize your ship is no small threat. "Alright alright, you've made your point already! Would a weapon suffice to leave us alone?"

choice.text: Nah, we'll just murder you anyways.

event.text: The captain steels their resolve and prepares to face you in combat.

choice.text: (Lvl 6 Weapons) Show the Elite you mean business.

event.text: You fire your entire salvo of weaponry at the Rebel vessel, narrowly missing it and vaporizing a nearby asteroid instead. The captain looks impressed, despite their best efforts to hide it. "Heh, nice laser light show you got over there. Listen - maybe we don't have to fight after all? It's not like I'm scared or anything - I just don't want to ruin the paint job."

choice.text: Reject the offer and begin combat.

event.text: "Your loss. I'll still win anyways." The Elite cuts comms and begins offensive mauevers.

Upon hearing Jerry speak, the captain's disposition shifts to one of amazement and reverence. "Wait, JERRY? I remember you from when I was stationed in the Protectorate! Can I get an autograph?"
"Uh, sure? What are you even doing over here anyways?"
"I, er, got transferred." The captain shuffles nervously. "Command needed more manpower over here, so they decided to transfer some of the Elites guarding the Protectorate to help with the U1 crisis. Personally, boring as hell."
After what feels like hours of idle chatter, the Rebel captain agrees to join your crew, claiming "you guys actually might stand a chance with me on board."

event.name: SURRENDER_FRONTIER_ELITE_INSULT
event.text: You receive a hail from the Elite's captain, having clearly undererestimated your shsip's strength. "Alright alright, you've made your point already! Just take this weapon and leave us alone!"

destroyed.text: You've defeated the Rebel Elite. Serves them right for insulting you.

event.text: It seems the Elite Rebel's cargo survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.
It seems the Elite Rebel's cargo survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.
Unfortunately, it appears the Elite Rebel's cargo did not survive the fight. At least the wreckage makes for good scrap.

deadCrew.text: The Elite's crew has been slain, leaving much loot and an intact weapon for the taking.
